Reviews.Title: more interesting than functional
Reviews.Author: Mark V. Demma
Reviews.Content: I like the phone.  It's made of plastic water bottles, has solar panels, and offers some other cool "green" features.  As far as the phone itself goes it's very average.  The solar panels do work but i've left it in the sun for an hour and barely gotten any kind of a charge from it.  Everything else is really just par for the course for what a phone is supposed to do.  It's a fine phone but way over priced.  If you appreciate it for its "green" efforts than maybe it's worth it to you, that's why i bought it and am fine with the price.

Reviews.Title: SW
Reviews.Author: SW
Reviews.Content: Great phone for the EMF ratings the bestkeyboard is the issue stinks its like an old phone ..but this phone has way to many good things going for itworks great great phone..

Reviews.Title: Great phone, but unlocked had no internet on AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Philip J. Hatlie
Reviews.Content: I really loved the phone but the unlocked version couldn't get internet through AT&T.;  I suspect this is yet another ploy by the mega company to force us to buy the AT&T; version of the phone.  I really did love the phone though.  Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Will Built not so smart
Reviews.Author: H. ALYAMI
Reviews.Content: Lack of arabic language support stopped me from using it, Solar charging is very weak and it takes very long time, but it helps in lack of AC power,GPS is stupid , no software for mapping or even simple use as saving location.very difficult navigation to change settings, no full keyboard while they can do it.no internet community support or even company support.

Reviews.Title: Environment-friendly shouldn't mean  feature poor
Reviews.Author: Khanukaev Nicolas
Reviews.Content: First of all it is not Android-based, but Samsung's proprietary OS.For an average user it should be fine, but any advanced feature you'd expect from such a hardware, is unavailable.I used a Nokia 6021 for 5 years and expected to have more features from such an advanced device, but was disappointed - because everything is of gadget quality - beautiful, but hardly functional.Bluetooth is buggy and has to be restarted often if you want to use it for dial-up.The included web browser has only very basic features (e.g. no passwd saving), some sites work very randomly.Google Maps (with GPS) often leads to reboots.Sync'ing with the PC is only possible under Windows, using Samsung's heavy gadget-like software.

ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Blue Earth S7550 Unlocked GSM Phone. With Solar Charging Panel, 3.2mp Camera.
